snippet: Law enforcement officials expressed a kind of bleak gratitude that a masked gunman with a semiautomatic rifle did not kill or wound more people in a crowded mall.
abstract: Oregon law enforcement officials express bleak gratitude that masked gunman Jacob Tyler Roberts, armed with semiautomatic rifle, did not kill or wound more people in crowded suburban mall near Portland; Roberts killed two people and severely wounded another in shooting rampage at Clackamas Town Center Mall, before killing himself, but officials say that with as many as 10,000 shoppers, toll could have been far higher.

byline.original: By KIRK JOHNSON and SERGE F. KOVALESKI
byline.contributor: Kirk Johnson reported from Clackamas, and Serge F. Kovaleski from New York. Lee van der Voo contributed reporting from Portland, Ore. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Law enforcement officials expressed a kind of bleak gratitude that a masked gunman with a semiautomatic rifle did not kill or wound more people in a crowded mall.

headline.seo: In Oregon Mall Shooting, a Lower Toll, Including Gunman Jacob Tyler Roberts
headline.main: Series of Turning Points Limited Death Toll at Oregon Mall
headline.print_headline: Series of Turning Points Kept Mall Toll Lower Than Feared
